p:
We conducted random forests analysis to identify the climatic and lake morphological drivers of the mean stratification onset and break-up dates during the historic period. The randomForest function in R
50, 51 was used for this analysis. Random forests are based on an ensemble of decision trees
52 . We generated 1000 trees from which we calculated variable importance to generally identify how often a predictor variable was the most important predictor in a single decision tree. We used the mean decrease in accuracy, describing the prediction error calculated by the mean squared error on the out-of-bag portion of the data
50 . Spearmanâ€™s correlations were subsequently calculated to assess the relationships between all variables using the correlate function in R
53 .
